jsondiscoverer

Class JsonSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • jsondiscoverer.AbstractJsonSource
      • jsondiscoverer.JsonSource
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SingleJsonSource

    public class JsonSource
extends AbstractJsonSource
    This class represents a JSON source. A JSON source is represented by a set of JSON documents with the same meaning (i.e., set of JSON documents returned by the same JSON-based Web API).

    In the context of JSON Discoverer, it is used to model a single JSON-based Web service.

    JSON documents are represented as JsonData elements.

    The set of JSON documents can be retrieved by calling the method getJsonData().

    As JsonData elements can include input elements (to represent which JSON data has triggered such JSON document), a JsonSource can include JsonData elements with or without input. To know whether the JsonData elements included in the JsonSource have input elements, you have to call the method withInput.

    Note that all the JsonData elements included in a JsonSource have to include (or not include) inputs.

    Author:
    Javier Canovas (me@jlcanovas.es)

      Fields

      protected java.util.List<JsonData> jsonData
      List of JSON documents
      boolean withInput
      Sets if the set of JSON documents are the result of computing an input JSON document (to support JSON-based Web APIs)

    • Field Detail

      • jsonData

        protected java.util.List<JsonData> jsonData
        List of JSON documents

      • withInput

        public boolean withInput
        Sets if the set of JSON documents are the result of computing an input JSON document (to support JSON-based Web APIs)

    • Constructor Detail

      • JsonSource

        public JsonSource(java.lang.String name)
        Builds a new JsonSource with a name. Once created, the JsonSource has to be populated by calling addJsonData(Reader, Reader).
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the JsonSource

    • Method Detail

      • getJsonData

        protected java.util.List<JsonData> getJsonData()
        Gets the set of JsonData elements linked to this source. Warning: the returned list is mutable
        Returns:
        The set of JSON documents (as JsonData

      • includesInput

        public boolean includesInput()
        Indicates if the JsonSource includes input elements.

        Note that all of them have to include (or not include) input elements

        Returns:
        Boolean indicating the status

      • buildJsonData

        private JsonData buildJsonData(java.io.Reader input,
                               java.io.Reader output)
        Builds a JsonData element out of a JSON document representing the input and another JSON document representing the output.

        The input/output must be provided as a valid JSON objects.

        Parameters:
        input - The Reader from which obtain JSON document used as input (optional)
        output - The Reader from which obtain the JSON document
        Returns:
        The JsonData with the JSON document and the input
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If any reader is null

      • addJsonData

        public void addJsonData(java.io.Reader input,
                        java.io.Reader output)
        Adds a new JSON document as well as the input JSON document (optional) to get such a document.

        The input/output must be provided as a valid JSON objects.

        Warning: Once the source has been created with input (or without), subsequent calls must also include (or not) inputs

        Parameters:
        input - The Reader from which obtain the JSON document used as input (optional)
        output - The Reader from which obtain the JSON document
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If input is null
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the JSON source was initially created to not hold input data

      • getSourceDigested

        public java.util.List<com.google.gson.JsonObject> getSourceDigested()
        Generates a list of JSON objects according to the JsonData of this source.

        • If the source DOES include inputs, the list will include the set of input elements as roots for the JsonData. For instance:

          •  - [input JSON element 1]
   +-- Output
       +-- [output JSON element 1]  
 - [input JSON element 2]
   +-- Output
       +-- [output JSON element 2]  
 -...
        • If the source DOES NOT include inputs, the list will include all the objects from JsonData. For instance

          •  - [output JSON element 1]  
 - [output JSON element 2] 
 - [output JSON element 3] 
 -...
        Returns:
        The list of JsonObjects
